text: Lars-Eric Lundvall (3 April 1934 - 8 April 2020) was a Swedish ice hockey player and coach. Between 1956 and 1965 he played 195 international matches and scored 79 goals. He played for the national team and for Frölunda. He won the world championship in 1962 and a silver medal during the 1964 Winter Olympics. Lundvall died on 8 April 2020 at the age of 86.Frölundas första guldkapten död ==References== Category:1934 births Category:2020 deaths Category:Swedish ice hockey left wingers Category:Olympic silver medalists for Sweden
title: Lars-Eric Lundvall
